Reviews.Title: “Bathroom is see-through!”
Reviews.Author: Ewuss
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great from the outside and inside as well. It is nice,clean and stylish. However, during my stay there: 1. The air conditioning didn't work in one of the rooms. However, we got transferred to a better room. Weird smell was coming from the air conditioning in all the rooms. 2. The bathroom doors are see-through which is really weird and uncomfortable. 3.Staff helpfulness was so-so . I guess the fact that it is not expensive covers for the facts I just described.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool lighting”
Reviews.Author: Dede A
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel and the lighting in the room was very cool. However, the room was hot because they are not allowed to turn the A/C on before a certain date. Make sure you are traveling with someone you are close with since the bathroom door is see through. This is a nice property a bit off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Below Average Location for access to central Rome”
Reviews.Author: RichJ19
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was decent and modern, but the location is well outside the sights of Rome. Only recommend staying here if you are attending a conference nearby. And check first to see if they allow their air conditioners to be turned on! We were there in February when the weather was mild but pleasant, however the rooms were very warm as they don't turn on their air conditioning at that time. An unpleasant surprise. More modern than many hotels, but not worth it if you are hoping to explore the sights of ancient Rome by foot. Stayed in two alternative hotels in Rome during our two week trip to Italy, both much preferred over this hotel (see reviews on Hotel Grand Gianacolo and Hotel Campo De Fiori - both superior options).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel doubles as a sauna!”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ran Mantegna as part of a Traalgar tour. The rooms wee spacious and well appointed and the facilities of the hotel were fine but the aircon was stifling and no amount of requests to look at it made any difference. The staff were pretty offhanded and I'm unsure if that is just typical Italian service or just this hotel. Wifi is available for 5 Euros a day but only in the lobby. I would consider other hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good one but too far...”
Reviews.Author: RenatoLoaiza
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights. I found a very neat and organised hotel. However couple of things: 1- too far from the real Rome (where the real fun is). 2- No WiFi in the rooms!! I didn't really understand the second one at all. Only with cable and no WiFi?? Besides this everything was very good and the people are very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: jangale
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here with a Trafalgar tour. The hotel is newer and quite modern. You are in a residential area far removed from Old Rome. However, there is one bus a short walk away that takes you to the tourist area. If you want to see the attractions, stay at the Hotel Corot. Hot water was the best we had in Europe. The blue lights were a bit unsettling, as well as all the glass separating the loo from the bedroom. If I had shared the room with someone other than my husband I would have been embarrassed. The front desk staff was very pleasant, providing us with bus info. Breakfast was plentiful, if not the best in quality. You don't feel you are in Europe here, it does have the mod cons. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again, yet it was comfortable enough for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. It was just horrible. A long way to down town Rome, we spent alot of money on taxes. This hotel has there price set way to high for what you get. No glasses in the room for your drinks. The sheets were so stuff you could get a paper cut. Th beds were old and felt well used. The staff was just horrible, they went out of there way not to help you. The cleaning staff was the best part of this place, they were nice and did a great job on cleaning the rooms. We will NOT be back and I would NOT stay in the place. To much money!

Reviews.Title: “Clear and Spacious Room but Very Far from the City”
Reviews.Author: Ozama
Reviews.Content: The Aran Mantegna hotel is a nice and clean hotel. I had a single king-bed room during a conference which was also held at the hotel premises. The room is spacious and has electric curtains which you can control while you are laying on the bed and watching TV. The bathroom is also spacious, clean, and well equipped. I've got a room at the upper floor and that caused problems in the speed of my internet connectivity so I had a very bad internet connection. In fact the internet connection was bad through the entire hotel. My colleagues at the conference told me that they even could not get a connection. Another problem with the hotel I think is the breakfast. Merely Italian with Croissant and Nutella which I found very limited. I did not like the breakfast nor the juice which I think was not too good. Finally, the hotel is very far from the city center. If you take a taxi you should expect to pay around 10 Euros! If you take the bus then you need to waste 45 minutes until you reach the main city center, which I think is called Piazza Venezia, because it goes around many places and bus stations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but a bus ride from the sights.”
Reviews.Author: mitchall m
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable and large. We slept well and the staff were very helpful. Although the location is little distance from the roman gates, you;ll be busing it anyways so as long as you don;t mind a little walking, it keeps you from all the frantic noise of the city. Close to ATM's/banks and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here as part of a Trafalgar tour group. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom with the frosted glass windows took some getting used to. The hotel mistakenly put my friend and me in a shared bed, but three rooms later we had our own comfy beds. No free wifi, it costs 8 Euros for one hour. This hotel is pretty far from the main tourist attractions, but being part of a tour group, that did not really affect us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: StanBoz
Reviews.Content: It's a long way from any sight-seeing and the staff wasn't particularly helpful or friendly. All the comments about lights in the room and the glass panels / door in the bathroom are accurate. On the other hand, the room was very comfortable and spacious and clean so I give it good marks. The buffet breakfast was about what you'd expect....lots of pastry and undercooked bacon, cheese....etc.

Reviews.Title: “somethings shouldnt be shared”
Reviews.Author: MDKbrisbane
Reviews.Content: the hotel was along way out from the centre of the city, the room was clean but i have never seen so many lights in a hotel room. i thought i was in a saturday night fever disco club. there was a huge mirror which had lights to give it a 3d effect. there were mood lights in the ceiling and the bathroom - 2 lights each on either side of the bed + the main lights. there were also remote controlled blinds. all sounds good but we couldnt get into our room unless you did a shoulder barge and when we told reception about this they just said that is the way it is.also the shower screen didnt fit properly so the bathroom was flooded everytime you showered. the see through door to the toilet was abit much and even though i was with my partner there are some things that should be kept private. breakfast was ok but couldnt stay long as the aircon was not on and it was rather hot in there. most probably did that to get people ou of there quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service= lot of customer but poor service!”
Reviews.Author: lesnsal
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to different tour groups like trafalgar, brenden and etc. from the parking lot you can seet 4-5 buses outside. We stayed here part of the trafalgar tour. we were 3 in the room. First, the bed configuration they gave us was 2 horizontal bed and one vertical bed at the foot area of the 2 horizontal bed. So i requested to be transferred to another room that has bed configuration of either 3 vertical bed or 3 horizontal bed. As i walked to the lobby, I saw some rooms with that configuration. So when iIreach the reception and told them my situation that I dont want to smell the feet of the two people, they said "all rooms have the same bed configurations. I told them that I just saw a room that has a better configuration and she dared me to tell her the room number. I told them its in the 2nd floor and she said that no rooms are like that. She went up with me to my original and I explained to her that i dont want to sleep smelling the feet of the 2 people infront of me. We argued and argued and she told me to talk to my tour director and walked out on me! Is that what you call service? walking away on a client? Why would I talk to my tour director about this problem? Its the problem of the hotel not the director. I chased her the hallway and raised my voice to her because what she did ( walking out) is not a good way to treat a guest. I went down to the reception again and some guy ( i think it was the manager )talked to me. He gave me options and to make the long story short, we got transfered to another room on the fifth floor with 3 beds side by side to each other. You see, the girl should not lie that all rooms are the same. Thats a very uncomfortable configuration. And what others commented about the bathroom, yes its true. Its very ugly to see your roommate using the urinal bec you can really see movements. Not good for friends to be together in a room. As for the bar, this is the first time i encountered that they accept credit card. My oh mY! what a shame. This hotel is really far from the city. Its quite costly to take a taxi to the city. From hotel to vatican, it was aorund 20eu. Im really disappointed with this hotel as they are part of the ARan group.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKen60657
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was satisfactory. However, the bathroom may be an issue to some people. In our room, the toilet and bathtub were in a separate compartment. The compartment wall is a frosted glass. It's not very private and movements can be observed. The hotel is part of a chain (Aran). This hotel seems to cater to escorted tours. We were on a Trafalgar tour. I thought the included breakfast was satisfactory; it's located on the lower level. The hotel's dining room is on the main floor. The menu seemed expensive. We needed a snack upon arrival and had a sandwich and drink at the hotel bar; nothing special. Sound really travels in the hotel corridors. On both nights of our stay, I was awakened by folks returning to their rooms at a late hour in an animated state. The hotel is located in a neighborhood although not centrally located. It's too far to walk to the subway. You need to take a bus to reach it. There are some food and drink places in the surrounding area but we didn't patronize them as we took part in the tour's planned and optional evening activities. There is a Catholic Church half a block away with Saturday and Sunday Masses at 6:30 PM plus other times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: slstretch
Reviews.Content: The hotel accomodations were very nice. We did not eat at the restaurant but did have included breakfasts which were good. Rooms were clean and service was excellent. Staff were helpful with everything from calling a taxi to luggage. It is a little out of the wat as far as location but a 10 euro taxi ride gets you everywhere. Catacombs are within walking distance. We would stay here again and there is a great coffee shop right down the road for local food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel located in a residential area......far from town.”
Reviews.Author: snowpeople
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Trafalgar tour and it looked like this hotel catered to lots of tour groups. Very modern and new. The rooms were large and spacious and very nice. Helpful staff all over. The breakfast buffet was very good as well. It was @ 15 euros for a taxi into town. The location is further out than I would have liked. Some nice neighbourhood restaurants nearby if you;re interested. Hotel was great but too far from town.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the bedrooms, but bathroom could see improvement”
Reviews.Author: dominictom
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently opened and the facilities are quite new and clean. There are two issues to highlight - the location and the bathroom. The hotel should seriously consider investing in a shuttle service from the San Paolo (nearest) metro station as it is really quite far to walk. The hotel could consider improving the shower curtain in the bathroom to prevent the floor from being splashed with water.

Reviews.Title: “OK but don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: piupolino
Reviews.Content: Restaurant OK, new and nice installations. Very good breakfast. If you are serious about using internet forget it: cumbersome and extremely slow even when connected by cable. Very limited offer of TV channels, I am writing this review while trying to watch Barcelona x Real Madrid (Champions League Semifinal 2011) but no channel is transmitting it. Airco is a joke. So it really depends what you need. Not considering to be back for business, maybe for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OperationCornedBeef
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aran Mantegna for a couple of nights for work. It is true that the hotel is not right downtown (you will have to take a taxi to go to town, which will cost you around 15 Euro each way and take 10 to 15 mins), but for my work the location was perfect. The hotel is brand new, very spacious and clean. The staff is nice and speaks good enough English. The rooms are very original, with a modern decor and some quite entertaining lighting systems. I got a VERY good rate for this hotel through my company, including breakfast (which is also very decent), so it makes it the best value for money I have encountered anywhere in the last few years. Only (minor) downpoints would be for me: - No free internet: You have to pay for this on top, which I find inconvenient. I would have preferred the room to be a few more Euro and to have this facility included. On another note I am not quite sure that the hotel is (yet) equipped to have Wifi in all rooms (I think even if you pay you still have to use an Ethernet connection). - Not much free TV: Basically you can get CNN or BBC World for free. All other options are Pay Per View (no movie/Sport/Documentary channels on the go) - I would personnally prefer if there would be a proper door to the bathroom/toilet, especially if I was not travelling on my own (these are sliding see-through doors made of polished glass) - I have seen in the comments that some other customers have had a problem with this. - I think they will have swimming pool & spa facilities soon, which are not yet open (perhaps the rates will increase then though :() Again: These are MINOR points, I am just detailing a bit as this is the only downpoints I saw to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: CDStern
Reviews.Content: for the location, food quality, price.. was not too worth it for me. internet was super expensive, not too sure whether to blame myself for bringing work with me everywhere or to blame the hotel for charging so much money for jsut one-day use. breakfast could be better, i like my soft-boiled eggs warm and soft and my orange juice not diluted. room was nice and clean, so no complain about that.

Reviews.Title: “New modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a Trafalgur tour. The hotel is newer and modern. Rooms were spacious and well equipped with minibar, flat screen tv and some really cool lighting. You need to play around with the lighting to see what all the numerous switches do. You need to pay for everything including Internet, tv or even music. The only things free on the tv are news channels, abt 2 channels in English. As others have commented, the bathroom door is see through and can be uncomfortble for non couples. Bahroom was decent and clean with plenty of space for hanging and storage of clothes, big vanity and sink and rain shower in bathtub. Location is not central, out of city but bus stops are nearby and we caught the bus to city no problems encountered. Not too many places to eat around the hotel and this was the annoying part. At 3 on one of the 2 days we were there, I got hungry so went to get some food. The few restaurants around the hotel were closed, siesta time I guess. The hotel dis not have room service between 2:30 to 7:00 pm I think it was. It's restaurant was not open during that time and although the bar was open, there was no bar food available. So between those hours, no food available. There is a supermarket open about 5 mins from hotel and you can get all your groceries from there including breads and cheese in case you are hungry. Staff were polite and impersonal. They should put some carpeting in the hallways as when the luggage or cleaning carts go past your door it sounds like a plane taking off. No fitness centre at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel. great room, far from centre”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Hill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a Trafalgar tour. The hotel is very nice, very modern, large well appointed rooms (and as others have mentioned yes with cool lights - but I was more freaked out by the mirror - I still dont know if anyone was watching me..). The only issue I had (similar to most of the Trafalgar hotels) is location. It is a fair hike from Rome city. If you are on a tour it isnt a problem but if you are on your own, stay closer to Rome. But it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and modern but unfinished”
Reviews.Author: ptitefunambule
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel (2 nights) during a tour of Europe, Traditional Europe, organized by Trafalgar. We travelled as a group and I always shared a room with my boyfriend. Our room was beautiful, large, modern and clean. We had lights all around the headboard of our bed and blacklights on the ceiling. The washroom was very modern, although the shower doors did not close properly (little flood on the floor). The window is from floor to ceiling and you have switch operated blinds. They were very fun and efficient to use. The hotel seemed to have Wi-Fi internet service (at a cost), but I did not clearly understand what the lady at the front desk was explaining. I just let it slide and did not use the internet. The hotel is either being remodeled or has been newly built because the pool and gym were not open to the public yet, which was unfortunate. Buffet breakfasts were good. The lobby and wahrooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel but not close to tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Nellie777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first two nights of our Trafalgar Tour in Europe. The hotel is very modern and has comfortable beds, a good bathroom (except for the strange see through door) and a nice welcoming foyer/bar area. The buffet breakfast was very average with the usual watery powdered eggs, cold meats, cheese, yoghurt, cereal, juice etc. served buffet style. The location of the hotel is probably the most detracting feature. It is quite a long way from many of Rome's attractions. Having said that, a group of us managed to catch the local bus to see the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps on a Friday then had dinner at a local restaurant before returning to the hotel around midnight. The neighbourhood is a little run down but there is safety in numbers and we didn't encounter any problems. Other than that, the location was not a problem for us as we went everywhere on the tour bus and thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise if you're looking for an hotel near EUR”
Reviews.Author: totoz_EU
Reviews.Content: Imagine a nearly new white&brown hotel near the EUR, with plenty of space inside and outside, you can use even for meeting of 200 people. Then add beautiful and quiet room with different light schemas and really comfortable bed. If you do not care for a rigid staff, than you can enjoy an high level experience for not-so-bad prices. On top of that this hotel is 5 minuts from my Rome office, so it's perfect to move in the south part of Rome. Restaurant is good and continental breakfast in the average.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbtran321
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for two nights for a tour guide package. This was our first hotel on the tour. When checking in, the staff were able to communicate in English. Hotel is very stylish, contemporary inside. Beds: We stayed in a double twin bed. Clean room, very interesting commodities. You either had a red or blue theme (the lamps and ceiling recess lightings) See the hotels pics. They had a mirror at foot of bed with depth lighting. Bedding was firm but soft with the pillows and blankets. The beds were right next to each other though. Bathroom: The toilet/tub is separated from the main sink by a frosted sliding glass that you can still see through and make out blurry body part outline. Really odd if staying with a friend/buddy. Should not be a problem if significant other. Toilet present and a female bidet.(brand new if not familiar with the European styles. The do not have small washcloths present so may need to bring or ask desk for one. Amenities: A safe present, areas for luggage, closet, tv with italian channels, couch present, windows that can be open and has 2 layers curtains. Must insert card at door to activate lighting and room. Very moden inside. AC present . Breakfast: Apprenthly the usual european stuyle cold meats, bacon, soggy eggs, various breads, juice, milk, water, coffee machine, pastry (croissants, pound-cake, rolls)fruit, fruit cocktails, pruns and canned fruit. Buffet style for breakfast if included. There was a lobby, bar area, and restaurant present but did not utilize on he trip. Location: Not near much of anything bedside small shops. In the residential area. There was a pizza joint in front that was good. Not much tourist or sight seeing opportunities by walking distance. Bus/Rail were not used or conveniently located near. Good if using taxi, coach bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but noisy and too far from city center”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose4606
Reviews.Content: We were changed to this hotel from Trafalgar Tours when we had been confirmed for a hotel in the city center. My room was right over the entrance and was very noisy all times of the night, also it is in a neighborhood of many apartments and some of the noise came from the location. The hotel was clean with relative large rooms for Europe but way too far from the city center which then entailed taking a taxi each time you wanted to go from hotel to city or back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, modern place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 47of74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very modern, very clean place with a very friendly and helpful staff. The only drawback to the place is that it's distant from the main attractions. Otherwise I had no problems and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peek-a-boo bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ktjnemo
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. Weird lighting in the rooms - the teens liked it but they suspected the mirror of being 2-way (LOL). The pool and fitness area was not open/finished. There was not much in the area and it was run down in appearance. We went out and took a right out of the parking area (wrong way I guess) and ended up getting something to eat/drink at one of the funny little corner bar stands on a busy street cause nothing else was around. Ended up being fun though. The bathroom doors were completely see through (although they appear to be frosted)! And even if you're comfortable with who your staying with, how much do they really need to see? This may be more common in Europe, we ran into the same thing in Paris. But seriously...I need some privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waggyOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June, 2009 as part of our Trafalgar tour. There are multiple Aran hotels so we had to be sure to remember that we were at the Mantegna one. The room was very modern, with unusual lighting - of course that was the first thing we checked out. There was a safe and small fridge. The bathroom doors are very se-through at this hotel, which isn't a big deal, unless you're not comfortable with the person you're traveling with. We braved it on our own 1 night and went to Rome on our own from the hotel. It was just me and my 15 year old daughter and I'm so glad we did that, but it was a little adventure. To get to the bus, you need to go past the parking lot security guard, turn left at the 1st street you come to, and then turn left again at the 1st street you come to, and then left again at the 1st street you come to (you would think you could just turn right and avoid all that, but NO - don't do that, you will not get where you want to go!). The area to walk in is not unsafe or scary, but maybe you could call it a little run-down. Not a big deal, but it would have been better to have a guy with us. However, it turned out to be a great adventure, and if you are part of a tour group, I would recommend trying to go out on your own!!!

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, no irons, weak air cond.”
Reviews.Author: slambiase
Reviews.Content: this was one of the worst business hotels I have been to. It was new and clean with kooky lighting - but so what if you are sweating and can't iron your clothes? I would not stay here again. breakfast was mediocre at best. the staff was awful and very unhelpful. when i asked for a manager, they basically said they would charge me more! the bar was closed when we got back from dinner - which was not very late. there is nothing to do in this area. I recommend staying in Rome city center - Villa borghese, barberini, via veneto area

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: franrich08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with a Trafalgar Tour. Modern and new, large rooms with interesting lighting. Heard others complain that it was not easy to get to the centre of Rome, but this didn't affect us as we were with a tour. Service good. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky Room Lighting”
Reviews.Author: bob59_49
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel. Like the zen like atmosphere- white walls, marble floors, few accents. They have real clean and undeniably large rooms. Beds are small though. The lighting in the rooms are wonderful except for the red lights which I find tacky and the lights in the big mirror in front of the bed. Tried their restaurant and food was good and interesting. The location is quite far from the city centre. I will recommend it to people who have a lot of time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: viajeritita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and new and clean. Neutral colour and marble. No smoking smell, since the hotel built after the smoking ban. The hotel is good for people willing to experiment with public transportation, since you have to. Multiple buses go near, but not to, the hotel. They take about 30 minutes to get into Rome. One can walk to the metro in 30 minutes, after which it's 5 minutes into Rome. Lightlng in the room was groovy. The staff allege a pool is under construction, which would be great, as one needs a swim after the hike from the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Water&Salt
Reviews.Content: Stayed there while on a tour with Trafalgar. Hotel is new, modern and very clean. Despite the fact that it was used by Trafalgar, it was relatively quiet which I like (read somewhere that hotels used by big tour agents are usually very noisy and crowded). It's located quite a distance from the city center. Nothing interesting nearby, it's more of a residential area. Understand from staff city center is 15mins away by bus. Bathroom is translucent so can be abit of a problem if you are not travelling with your other half. Room size is good, very comfy but don't understand the mirror with flicking lights, abit off I thought and the red ceiling light too.

HotelInfo.Name: Barcelo Aran Mantegna
HotelInfo.Address: Via Andrea Mantegna 130 | via Paolo Veronese, 00147 Rome, Italy
